trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of selected items in a list view control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> stores the selected items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> are items contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> as well as their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Index
Item
Selection state in the ListView
Item1
Unselected
Item2
Selected
Item3
Unselected
Item4
Selected
Item5
Selected

Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> would appear.
Index
Selected item in the ListViewItemCollection
Item2
Item4
Item5
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.

Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control that owns the collection.
Removes all items from the collection.
This method enables you to clear all selections from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is one of the selected items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.

Once you know that the item is in the selected item collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item to locate in the collection.
`true` if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether an item with the specified key is contained in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false`.
The name of the item to find in the collection.
`true` to indicate the specified item is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine the selected items from multiple collections into a single array.
An <xref href="System.Array"></xref> representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.
The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of selected items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.

Unless the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.MultiSelect%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is set to `true`, this property always returns a value of zero (0) or one (1) depending on whether you have a selected item.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the selected item collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the collection of selected items.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.

Once you know that an item is in the selected item collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item in the collection.
If the item is not located in the collection, the return value is negative one (-1).
Returns the index of the first occurrence of the item with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The name of the item to find in the collection.
The zero-based index of the first item with the specified key.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `true` for this collection.
The items in the collection can only be modified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an item with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Item%2A> returns `null`.
The name of the item to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> with the specified key.
Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.
This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.

The item stored in the collection is an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item located at the specified index within the collection.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To add a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
An object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection"></xref>.
The location of the added item.
Always thrown.
Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
An object that represents the item to locate in the collection.
`true` if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index, within the collection, of the specified item.
An object that represents the item to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1
Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To add a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The zero-based index of the item to be inserted.
An object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
`true` in all cases.
Gets or sets an an object from the collection.
The zero-based index of the element to get.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.
Removes the first occurrence of a specified item from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The object to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Removes an item from the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Always thrown.
